name: I am a foreign-born child of a U.S. citizen claiming citizenship through parentage.

children.name: At the time of my birth, my parents were married.
Both my parents were U.S. citizens when I was born.
Can you provide sufficient proof of your birth, your parents' marriage and their citizenship?
I have sufficient documentary proof of my birth, my parents' marriage and their citizenship.
Only if you are suspected of fraud will your DNA be requested. It is still optional.
I do not have documentary proof of my birth, my parents' marriage and/or their citizenship.
You may have no other choice but to submit to DNA testing or withdraw your claim. Why?
Only one of my parents was a U.S. citizens when I was born.
Can you provide sufficient proof of your birth, your parents' marriage and their citizenship?
I have sufficient documentary proof of my birth, my parents' marriage and their citizenship.
Only if you are suspected of fraud will your DNA be requested. It is still optional.
I do not have documentary proof of my birth, my parents' marriage and/or their citizenship.
You may have no other choice but to submit to DNA testing or withdraw your claim. Why?
Neither of my parents was a U.S. citizen when I was born.
You do not qualify for U.S. citizenship through parentage.
At the time of my birth, my parents were not married.
I am claiming citizenship through my father, who was a U.S. citizen at the time of my birth.
I was born before November 14th, 1968.
Can you provide sufficient proof of your birth and your relationship to your father?
I have sufficient documentary proof of my birth and my relationship to my father.
Only if you are suspected of fraud will your DNA be requested. It is still optional.
I do not have sufficient documentary proof of of my birth and your relationship to my father.
You may have no other choice but to submit to DNA testing or withdraw your claim. Why?
I was on or after November 14th, 1968.
You are required to have 'clear and convincing' evidence of a 'blood relationship' to your father. This is a higher standard than usual.
Depending on your circumstances, it may be best to undergo DNA testing. [Dylan needs to rewrite this, you can skip it for now.]
Extra section to be added. optional.
I am claiming citizenship through my mother, who was U.S. citizen at the time of my birth.
Only if you are suspected of fraud should you be asked to submit to DNA testing.
I was conceived using assisted reproductive technologies or surrogacy.
My birth mother is my legal mother.
My birth mother is also my genetic mother.
Is your birth mother a U.S. citizen?
Yes.
Was your birth mother married at the time of your birth?
Yes, to another U.S. citizen.
You are considered to be a child of two U.S. citizen parents.

I have sufficient documentary proof of my birth, my parents' marriage and their citizenship.

I do not have sufficient documentary proof of my birth, my parents' marriage and/or their citizenship.

Yes, to a non-U.S. citizen
You are considered to be a child born in wedlock to a U.S. citizen mother.
